title: Getting Started with Static Blogs
content:
Static blogs are becoming increasingly popular due to their simplicity and performance benefits.

With a static blog:

  • No database required
  • Faster loading times
  • Easier to maintain
  • More secure

This particular implementation uses GitHub as a backend storage system.

title: The Benefits of Vanilla JavaScript
content:
While frameworks like React and Vue are popular, there are good reasons to use vanilla JavaScript:

  1. No build step needed - Just works in the browser
  2. Smaller bundle size - No framework overhead
  3. Long-term maintainability - No framework version upgrades
  4. Better fundamentals - You learn the actual web platform

For simple projects like this blog, vanilla JS is often the perfect choice.

title: How This Blog Works
content:
Architecture Overview

This blog uses a clever combination of:

  • GitHub as a data store (posts.json)
  • GitHub REST API for CRUD operations
  • Pure frontend code (HTML/CSS/JS)

Key Features

The system includes:

  • Post listing page
  • Individual post pages
  • Admin interface for writing posts
  • Automatic date handling

All without any backend code or frameworks!
